messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/api.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostCommentController@index` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/v1/posts/{post}/comments`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/api.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostCommentController@index`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Files containing the implementation:

- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostCommentController.php

Explanation:

- I searched the codebase for the PostCommentController class and found the API controller at app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostCommentController.php. This file defines the class App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostCommentController and implements the index(Request $request, Post $post): ResourceCollection method used by the route /v1/posts/{post}/comments. The index method returns a paginated collection of comments (with author relation) wrapped in CommentResource.
- Note: there is also a similarly named web controller at app/Http/Controllers/PostCommentController.php, but its namespace is App\Http\Controllers (not App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1). The route in routes/api.php references App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostCommentController, so the API controller above is the one used.
